name: Peanut Butter Fudge
headline: Peanut Butter Fudge
keywords: Candy Recipes and Ideas,Fudge Recipes,Thanksgiving,Christmas,Nut Recipes,Peanut Butter,Dessert,Gluten Free,Low Sodium
recipeIngredient: 1 cup butter, plus more for greasing pan

recipeInstructions.text: Microwave butter and peanut butter for 2 minutes on high. Stir and microwave on high for 2 more minutes. Add vanilla and confectioners¿ sugar to peanut butter mixture and stir to combine with a wooden spoon. Pour into a buttered 8 by 8-inch pan lined with waxed paper. Place a second piece of waxed paper on the surface of the fudge and refrigerate until cool. Cut into 1-inch pieces and store in an airtight container for up to a week.

This an easy, fast, delicious recipe...and YES - you can make chocolate flavor in the nuke oven! I always read other reviews and experimant with other user's advice. It's true this is a very sweet recipe - but isn't most fidge very sweet? Anyway - I made two bacthes - the peanut butter and my own version...I used the 1 cup of peanut butter (Use a natural peanut butter for real flavor), I also grated (with a cheese grater) about 2-3 ounces of Ghirardelli's non-sweetened baker's chocolate I had leftover in the freezer on top of the butter and peanutbutter before I microwaved. After microwaving - I added the vanilla and about 2 Tablespoons of real maple syrup. Added the sugar and mashed all together like recipe says...I'm here to tell you it came out AWESOME! The choclate cut some of the sweetness and I know your wondering..HOW LONG in the fridge...Give it a minimum of 1 hour - but it tastes 10X better when the flavors meld for a few hours or overnite! Be sure to cover with the wax paper as Alton says! Enjoy & Merry X-Mas. Thanks again Alton you rock!
